title: BADecker
author: BADecker
content: So, guns aren't going away after all!Anti-Gunners About To Meltdown After Elon Musk Says 'Armed Citizens Vital For Democracy's Defense'https://www.zerohedge.com/political/anti-gunners-about-meltdown-after-elon-musk-says-armed-citizens-being-vital-democracysElon Musk most likely upset anti-gunners at Everytown and Giffords this weekend with his post on X, stating, "As tragic as the mass shootings are, armed citizens are essential to the defense of democracy." Musk's comment was in response to an X user named "End Wokeness," who highlighted, "The past 3+ years have been one long infomercial for the 2nd amendment."----------End Wokeness@EndWokeness·FollowThe past 3+ years have been one long infomercial for the 2nd amendment:•Lockdowns and vax mandates•Months of race riots and looting•Police are defunded, crime rages•Soros DAs let criminals roam free•Millions of illegals storm the border•Hillary calls for re-education… [Show more]----------End Wokeness listed a series of events, including Covid lockdowns and lawless metro areas, as some of the reasons why law-abiding Americans panic-bought guns in recent years. According to the latest data from the FBI's National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS), which serves as a proxy for gun sales, because there is no national database tracking firearm purchases, gun demand surged during the early days of Covid. It continued erupting as Black Lives Matter protests/riots sparked concern for safety among millions of Americans. Gun demand has since plunged since panic buying was merely a bubble. comments.body: Actually. I think Hillary did not use the word "re-education", but rather "deprogramming* because in her opinion, most of Trump voters and backers are hypnotized in a cultist-like state, but that only her opinion and the opinion of a handful of people. On the issue of weapons: Since I do not live in the USA, I do not have as much saying as someone from there could have, however, if I lived there I would not mind for people to have their guns, as long as there is a bipartisan effort to protect innocent people (including children) to fall victim of a madman with a semi automatic rifle. I do not mind whether it is a hobby thing, a representation of the 2th amendment, or just people who like to shoot for fun. Guns are okey, but killing indiscriminately is not and won't even be ...Republican lawmakers, by the way, talk much about mental issues and yet are not willing to fund programs to tackle mental health in an affordable way.
